{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3598439,"name":"9016 captain/head prgm/driver","username":"Mehmet1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mehmet1/{size}/238645_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-21T13:33:20.633Z","cooked":"

Our code uses the AdvantageKit TalonFX Swerve, Vision, and the general IO philosophy for the other subsystems as well. We use Superstructure.java to run our finite state machine, and each subsystem has a Hashmap to see what value it should go to depending on the Superstate of the robot, but this may not be relavant.

For the past few competitions, we have been having significant loop overruns (LOG CD.zip (223.2 KB)), our Rio 2’s CPU >85-90% very consistently. This happens both at home and at the official field.

I realize that the robot felt weird to drive all season, almost as if it was “unresponsive” or it hesitated when I drove it. The robot also follows paths weirdly, I have to slow them down in order to follow accurately.

I see that most top teams (most teams in general) don’t seem to be struggling with these issues.

Can anyone see why the overruns are happening so often? Do you have general tips for optimizing code to reduce CPU usage on the RoboRio and good coding tips in general?

@Gold87
Have you become the master of loop overruns yet as you’ve caused a few? Or at least able to echo the answers others provided you.

The best way to optimize your code would be to just sit with VisualVM and see what takes the most resources

For us it was streams and string concatenation, so try to avoid these

image820×227 32.6 KB

Also one thing which helped us a lot was to call BaseStatusSignal.refreshAll once per loop cycle on ALL status signals instead of a per device/subsytem basis.

Doing just these things got us running pose estimation 4 cameras + on-the-fly pathing + advantagekit on a Rio1 with only occasional overruns, so I highly recommend.

Good luck!

A few general tips:

  • Never do lots of complex calculations in periodic functions.
  • Avoid sending too much data to NetworkTables/the dashboard periodically; I would recommend sending data every 100ms rather than 20ms, and pare down how much you send in general.
  • Avoid doing too much work with cameras on the RIO
  • Analyze everything with VisualVM

I can’t look at your code very well since I’m on a phone, but with consistently high CPU usage it’s almost certainly computationally intensive tasks being performed in subsystem/robot periodics.

Most cases are going to be because of frequent use of blocking CAN calls.
